Description: Fragment of wool and linen, plain weave textile with a square panel of tapestry (single warp threads); Dark blue design of lozenges enclosing leaves and diamonds, plain frame with wave outer border; Warp: wool, S-spun, c.8 tpc; Weft: wool and linen, S-spun, c.16-18 tpc in plain areas, c.50-55 in tapestry; edges: internal selvedges at sides of panel, one edge ragged and others cut
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, brown box; Probably from the shoulder or knee area of a tunic; Edges cut since excavation; Information from hero Granger-Taylor (1989)
